body.p: The Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) Guidelines is an international and interdisciplinary standard that enables libraries, museums, publishers, and individual scholars to represent a variety of literary and linguistic texts for online research, teaching, and preservation.
TEI P5 document typeassociation rulesTEI P5 document typeschemaThe TEI P5 document type is similar to TEI P4, with the following exceptions:
TEI P5 document typeschemaThe DTD schema used for these documents is located in [OXYGEN_DIR]/frameworks/tei/xml/tei/custom/schema/relaxng/tei_allPlus.rng.
The CSS file used for rendering TEI P5 content is located in [OXYGEN_DIR]/frameworks/tei/xml/tei/css/tei_oxygen.css.
TEI P5 document typeAuthor extensionscatalogsThere are two default catalogs for the TEI P5 document type:
To watch our video demonstration about TEI editing, go to http://oxygenxml.com/demo/WYSIWYG_TEI_Editing.html.
